title: WhatTheFont couldn't recognise this sans-serif font - please help!
content:
Hi all,

I’ve tried several times on WhatTheFont, which usually identifies fonts with no trouble (I love it!)

If you could find the time to help me I’d be very grateful.

Thanks!
author: mlg85

comments.content: We can’t read minds... you’ll have to actually post a file for us to see. ;)

haha I thought I did! Here you are:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150017im_/http:/typophile.com/files/solutions_wtf_3511.jpg)

There are very few differences between the image you uploaded and Frutiger:  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=frutiger&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=Solution...](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150017/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=frutiger&x=0&y=0&sample_text=Solutions&sample_size=96 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=frutiger&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=Solutions&sample\_size=96")

Oh thanks for that. I looked up ’Fonts like Frutiger’ and Charlotte Sans came up. Looks like Solutions is a custom warped version! Hope I’m right.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150017im_/http:/typophile.com/files/charlotte_sans_5834.jpg)
The modification made to the “i” in this example is horrible.

I’m pretty sure “Solutions” is not based on Charlotte Sans even tho there is some styling.

Mikey :-)

Looks like [Poynter Gothic Text Black Condensed Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150017/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/PoynterGothicText/styles) with the ’i’ altered...

—- Tamas Ferencz —-

No, the skeleton is different.

However, if you plan on rebuilding/refreshing the logo then Poynter looks much better—much more even.

Mikey :-)
